Content:: Gobius is a genus of fish in the family Gobiidae native to fresh, brackish and marine waters of and around Europe, Africa and Asia. It contains the typical gobies, being the type genus of the formerly recognised subfamily Gobiinae and family and the namesake genus of its order Gobiiformes. There are currently 28 recognized species in this genus:[2]  This Gobiidae-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
